thread.title: Hal Holbrook to launch Alley interview series
thread.title_full: Hal Holbrook to launch Alley interview series - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Hal Holbrook to launch Alley interview series
text:
Photo: Kevin Winter, Staff Image 1 of / 2 2 Actor Hal Holbrook
Photo: Kevin Winter, Staff Actor Hal Holbrook Image 2 of 2 Dixie Carter and Hal Holbrook starred in the Alley Theatreâs world premiere of "Be My Baby."
Photo: T Charles Erickson Dixie Carter and Hal Holbrook starred in the Alley Theatreâs... Hal Holbrook to launch Alley interview series 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Famed actor Hal Holbrook will inaugurate the Alley Theatre 's new Alley Up Close series on Oct. 19.
Holbrook will appear "in conversation" with Alley artistic director Gregory Boyd , launching the series of interviews with notable writers, actors and directors.
Holbrook is best known for his many performances in his solo show " Mark Twain Tonight!" He has been performing as Twain since the 1950s, winning a 1966 Tony for the role.
His distinguished career includes Broadway productions from Arthur Miller 's "After the Fall" to Wendy Wasserstein's "An American Daughter." He has won five Emmys for his extensive TV work, including the series "The Senator" and landmark TV films such as "That Certain Summer" and "Pueblo." His film credits range from "The Group" to "Lincoln" and his Oscar-nominated role in "Into the Wild." He played recurring roles in "Evening Shade" and in "Designing Women," opposite his late wife, Dixie Carter .
Holbrook and Carter starred in the Alley's 2005 world premiere of Ken Ludwig 's "Be My Baby."
Alley Up Close with Hal Holbrook will take place at 7:30 p.m. Oct. 19 in the Hubbard Theatre . Information: alleytheatre.org or 713-220-5700.
